DataElement.preferredName: CD3 Complex CD8 Antigen Laboratory Procedure Viable Cell Count Performed Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric laboratory percentage value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of viability of cells for CD3+CD8+ cells.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: CD3 Complex CD8 Antigen Laboratory Procedure Viable Cell Count Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Consisting of cell surface type I membrane Delta, Epsilon, Gamma, Zeta, and Eta protein subunits with ITAM domains and noncovalently associated with the disulfide bound heterodimeric alpha/beta and gamma/delta TCR, the CD3 complex couples receptor antigen recognition to signal transduction pathways during T-cell activation. During TCR engagement with MHC-associated antigen on host cell surfaces and synapse formation, CD3 activity leads to Tyr-phosphorylated CD3 subunits, Tyr phosphorylation of LAT colocalized in lipid rafts, and MAPK activation. CD3 signal transduction appears to involve LCK, ZAP70, Nck, SLA, SLA2, and DOCK2. CD3 subunits may also associate with the cytoskeleton. CD3 also mediates TCR signal transduction during the developmental transition through positive selection of immature thymocytes to mature CD4+ or CD8+ T cells. (NCI)_T-cell surface glycoprotein CD8 beta chain (210 aa, ~24 kDa) is encoded by the human CD8B gene. This protein plays a role in T-cell cytotoxicity._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._The determination of the number of viable cells in a sample._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredName: CD3 Complex CD8 Antigen, Beta Polypeptide 1 Laboratory Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Consisting of cell surface type I membrane Delta, Epsilon, Gamma, Zeta, and Eta protein subunits with ITAM domains and noncovalently associated with the disulfide bound heterodimeric alpha/beta and gamma/delta TCR, the CD3 complex couples receptor antigen recognition to signal transduction pathways during T-cell activation. During TCR engagement with MHC-associated antigen on host cell surfaces and synapse formation, CD3 activity leads to Tyr-phosphorylated CD3 subunits, Tyr phosphorylation of LAT colocalized in lipid rafts, and MAPK activation. CD3 signal transduction appears to involve LCK, ZAP70, Nck, SLA, SLA2, and DOCK2. CD3 subunits may also associate with the cytoskeleton. CD3 also mediates TCR signal transduction during the developmental transition through positive selection of immature thymocytes to mature CD4+ or CD8+ T cells. (NCI):suppressor T-lymphocyte marker that functions as a receptor for MHC class I antigen.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: A protein complex comprised of one T-cell surface glycoprotein CD3 delta chain (CD3D), one T-cell surface glycoprotein CD3 gamma chain (CD3G) and two T-cell surface glycoprotein CD3 epsilon chains (CD3E). CD3D, CD3G and CD3E are transmembrane proteins with one extracellular immunoglobulin domain and one intracellular ITAM domain. The CD3 complex is a T-cell co-receptor that noncovalently associates with either the disulfide bound heterodimeric alpha/beta T-cell receptor (TCR) or gamma/delta TCR and two copies of the accessory protein, T-cell surface glycoprotein CD3 zeta chain (CD247), which is a transmembrane protein with three ITAM domains. The TCR moiety of the TCR-CD3 complex binds to MHC and processed antigens on antigen presenting cells, which triggers phosphorylation of and cellular propagation of the signal by CD247 and the CD3 complex.

Concepts.longName: T-Cell Surface Glycoprotein CD8 Beta Chain
Concepts.definition: T-cell surface glycoprotein CD8 beta chain (210 aa, ~24 kDa) is encoded by the human CD8B gene. This protein plays a role in T-cell cytotoxicity.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Capable of life or normal growth and development._The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid._A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Capable of life or normal growth and development.:The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid. Cells are highly variable and specialized in both structure and function, though all must at some stage replicate proteins and nucleic acids, utilize energy, and reproduce themselves.:Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
